captions.text:
[MUSIC]
>>I BET THAT THIS IS GRANDMA’S.

>>I KNOW. I KNOW. CAN'T WAIT TO SEE. GRANDMA.
GRANDMA. LOOK WHAT WE FOUND.

>>WHOA. OH MY! MY OLD KEEP SAKE BOX. WHY I'VE
SAVED 100 MEMORIES IN THIS THING.

>>OH, YOU KNOW WHAT? LET ME RECORD THIS FOR
POSTERITY. OKAY. OKAY, GO AHEAD AND JUST TELL

US ALL ABOUT IT.
>>WELL LET ME SEE HERE. OH! OH MY! THIS IS

AN OLD TICKET STUB TO THE DRIVE IN PICTURE
SHOW. THAT WAS THE FIRST DATE YOUR GRANDFATHER

AND I EVER WENT ON.
>>NO WAY!

>>YEAH, YEAH!
>>THAT’S SO SWEET.

>>OH, AND HERE IS THE KEY TO OUR FIRST APARTMENT
AS A MARRIED COUPLE. AND OH! LOOKY HERE! OUR

FIRST DOLLAR FROM THE FIRST BANK WE EVER ROBBED.
>>SAY AGAIN?

>>YES, THOSE WERE THE DAYS. WE HELD UP EVERY
BANK WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI.

>>OH.
>>YOU’RE GRANDFATHER, HE- HE CARRIED THE

GUN AND I BECAME PRETTY HANDY WITH A SWITCHBLADE.
THAT SWITCHBLADE! OH NOW, CAREFUL MALLORY!

NOW, YOU REMEMBER A LADY IS ONLY AS GOOD AS
HER STABBING IMPLEMENT. YES, HERE WE GO. [LAUGHS]

OH, IT'S STILL GOT IT.
>>WELL THAT WAS A FUN, IF NOT UNEXPECTED STORY.

WHY DON'T WE-- WHY DON'T WE MOVE ON. WHAT
ARE THESE, GRANDMA?

>>MUG SHOTS. OH YES, WE WERE CORNERED DOWN
IN MEXICO AND AFTER THREE DAYS OF FIGHTING

AND UNSPEAKABLE CARNAGE, WE GAVE OURSELVES
A--

>>HOW LONG WERE YOU IN PRISON?
>>OH, NOT LONG. THEY HAD TO LET US GO ON A

TECHNICALITY.
>>OH.

>>BUT LET ME ASSURE YOU, WE WERE AS GUILTY
AS THEY COME.

>>THAT’S COMFORTING.
>>YES. BUT- BUT WE SAW OUR FREEDOM AS A NEW

LEASE ON LIFE. SO, YOUR GRANDFATHER AND I
DECIDED TO START A FAMILY.

>>OKAY, SEE THAT'S--
>>CRIME FAMILY.

>>OKAY.
>>YES WE RAN HE WHOLE EAST SIDE OF CHICAGO.

AND WE TRAFFICKED ALL KINDS OF ILLEGAL GOODS.
AND THE THINGS WE HAD TO DO TO STAY IN POWER,

LET ME TELL YOU, THERE WAS THIS ONE TIME I
HAD A SNITCH TURN UP IN THE BASEMENT-

>>- OKAY GRANDMA! OH, WHY DON'T WE SKIP AHEAD
TO THE PART WHERE YOU AND GRANDPA COMPLETELY

CHANGED AND BECAME GOOD LAW ABIDING CITIZENS?
>>OH, WELL. IT ALL BECAME TOO MUCH FOR US;

ALL THE VIOLENCE AND ALL THE BLACKMAIL AND
ALL THE SEVEN HORSE HEADS THAT WE PUT IN PEOPLE'S

BEDS. IT GETS MESSY. SO WE WENT STRAIGHT,
AS THEY SAY, AFTER JUST A FEW SHORT DECADES.

>>WELL WE'RE SO PROUD OF YOU.
>>YES YOUR GRANDFATHER HE BECAME A SCHOOLTEACHER

AND I SOLD PIES OUT OF THE HOUSE. YEAH, I
KNOW THAT'S NOT AS EXCITING AS-

>>NO, NO, NO, NO.
>>NO, GRANDMA. SEE, THAT'S SUPER SWEET AND

PICTURESQUE. ACTUALLY WHEN YOU TELL PEOPLE
YOUR HISTORY YOU REALLY SHOULD JUST JUMP TO

THAT PART OKAY?
>>YEAH.

>>OKAY. YEAH. OH, THANK YOU DEARS. THIS- THIS
HAS BEEN QUITE A DAY.

>>IT HAS.
>>YES, I'M FEELING KIND OF TUCKERED OUT. I

THINK I MIGHT GO AND TAKE A NAP. WOULD YOU
SEE THAT MY SWITCHBLADE GETS PUT BACK IN THE

BOX?
>>YES, I WILL DO THAT AND I'LL MAKE SURE THIS

STUFF GETS PUT SOMEWHERE SAFE AND VERY DEEP.
>>SWEET GIRL. SWEET GIRL MALLORY.

>>LET US KNOW IF YOU NEED ANYTHING. WE'LL-
>>YUP. MAYBE SOME OATMEAL.

>>OKAY.
[KNOCK ON DOOR]

>>GODMOTHER?
>>DON CAPESTRANI.

>>I'VE BROUGHT THE CASH FOR THE GOODS.
>>I'VE BROUGHT YOU THE GOODS FOR THE CASH.

>>GRANDMA... I'M JUST SLOWLY... OKAY.
>>YEAH, THERE'S SOMETHING WRONG WITH THAT

BOY.
>>YEAH.

>>WELL, GIVE MY LOVE TO YOUR FAMILY DON.
>>SURE WILL. THANKS GODMOTHER, YOU'RE THE

BEST!
>>OH SWEET BOY! YES. BUONANOTTE.

>>HEY GUYS! THANKS SO MUCH FOR WATCHING THAT
SKETCH.

>>COMMENT BELOW WITH YOUR CRAZIEST FAMILY
STORY.

>>AND DON'T FORGET TO SUBSCRIBE. OR ELSE.
>>OKAY.

>>LET’S PUT THAT AWAY.
>>NO.

>>GRANDMA-
>>THEY NEED TO KNOW.

>>THEY KNOW.
>>THEY’RE GOING TO RESPECT THEIR ELDERS.

>>DON’T POINT THAT AT THEM.
>>I'LL POINT WHATEVER I WANT TO POINT AT.

>>NO YOU-
>>RESPECT IS EARNED.

>>GRAMMY? WE TALKED ABOUT- NO.
>>THROW IT?

>>NO.
>>IT’S AN EXPENSIVE LENS.

>>YOU SHATTERED THE ILLUSION.
>>WHY?

comments.author: Shelby Allred

comments.text:
great family story..... whelp you asked.

Back when my great grandparents were digging out their new basement, my 
great grandfather *acquired* some blasting caps from his job at the coal 
mine. He told my grandfather and his sister to only use one to help dig out 
the basement. They took this as one each. They then proceeded to detonate 
the caps nearly blowing out the foundation (the house still stands today 
XD) they were promptly spanked afterwards.

A generation later, both my great grandparents passed away. During mourning 
the family went through all the nicknacks int the basement. My grandfather 
then found the old blasting caps which had at this point congealed into 
nitroglycerin. My grandfather called the sheriff who literally sped to the 
house, sprinted to the porch and asked for the caps.

To this day I think back to the fact that when I ate cream corn and ham I 
was a few summer degrees away from an abrupt and explosive death.

oh and I almost forgot to mention my great grandmother was a cancan dancer 
in her 'rebellious' phase what her father being a preacher and all X3﻿
comments.author: Oliver Fey

comments.text:
My whackiest family story is when my Dad and his friend rode a skateboard 
down the hill- as in, they were BOTH on the skateboard. As they went 
downhill, traffic began pouring in, and they ended up having a crash 
landing onto some grass near the bottom. P.S: Love the videos! Wish I had 
BYUTV so I could watch these as they air, but I guess that YouTube is as 
good as I'll get! I love what you guys do- keep it up!﻿

comments.text:
my family had a lot of hatfield ad mccoy stuff. my great uncle shot my 
great grandpa in the shoulder nearly blowing it off. my great grandpa 
worked as a bouncer amongst other more nefarious occupations. he once bit a 
mans face off because a rowdy drunk said he "wasnt afraid of a one armed 
bouncer." my great grandpa reached up with is good arm pulled his face to 
his bit a side of his face off. my granpa who was only 9 at the time, and 
in the bar no less said great grandpa stood over him and said "there is 
more than one way to bring a man down, and i only need one good arm for 
you."﻿

comments.author: Misti Yeager

comments.text:
Okay, this sounds fake but is absolute truth. My mom was on a trip to 
Australia around age 17 with my grandparents, and they went on a 
walk-through safari. Halfway in, the emus got a dark look in their eyes. 
Fun fact: emus are territorial. They came a after the family, so everyone 
started sprinting towards the exit. My mom tripped. My grandpa turned back 
to get her. The emu reared to strike. My grandpa held up my grandma's 20 
pound purse he'd been carrying, and blocked the emu's beak. My mom got up 
and they ran the heck out of there. Moral of the story: emus are evil.﻿

comments.text:
Craziest family story: one of my great great grandmothers was thrown onto 
the streets in England after her parents donated all of their assets to the 
local church. She was so angry that she burned down the church, was 
arrested, and was sent to a penitentiary in Tasmania. Learned this on my 
trip to visit family in New Zealand a few months ago #cray﻿
